channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for IN
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for IN

item.title: Report E-2024060059
item.description:
Report E-2024060059

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-12T00:36:30+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-15
  • City: GREENWOOD
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately five (5) gallons of material released from one (1) 5-gallon metal pail. The released material impacted the concrete terminal floor. Dayton Freight personnel cleaned the impacted area and placed the clean up debris and the damaged metal pail into one 10-gallon metal drum. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freight’s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024060065
item.description:
Report E-2024060065

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-10T18:15:13+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-05
  • City: ELKHART
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight observed approximately one (1) gallon of material released from one (1) 5-gallon metal pail due to a forklift puncture. The released material impacted the trailer floor. Dayton Freight personnel cleaned the impacted area with granular absorbents. The spent absorbents were gathered, and the recovered material and damaged pail was containerized into one (1) 55-gallon poly drum. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freight’s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report X-2024051758
item.description:
Report X-2024051758

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-10T18:15:13+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-21
  • City: INDIANAPOLIS
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: ON May 21st during the PM sort a package was found that was showing signs of leaking. The package was opened and it contained two plastic jerricans which held UN2319, Terpene Hydrocarbons N.O.S, 3, III. One of the caps appeared to be lose allowing the liquid to escape. The package was placed into a steel salvage drum and is pending disposition.

item.title: Report X-2024051292
item.description:
Report X-2024051292

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-05T15:12:36+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-16
  • City: PLAINFIELD
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: RESPONDER WAS CALLED OVER TO THE BELT, WHERE THE SUPERVISOR NOTIFIED RESPONDER THERE WAS POWDER LEAKING FROM THE CORNER OF THE BOX. RATHER THAN OPEN IT ON THE BELT, RESPONDER ELECTED TO BRING IT BACK TO THE CAGE FOR CLOSER EXAMINATION. ONCE THE BOX WAS OPEN, IT WAS CLEAR THAT THE LID OF THE SIX-GALLON BUCKET WAS LOOSE. RESPONDER PROCEEDED TO DAMAGE OUT PACKAGE
